name: docker-wordpress-starterkit
description: Starter kit for running Wordpress in development using Docker

scripts.docker:env:
echo "exec the following command:

    docker-machine start default || true && eval \$(docker-machine env default)"
scripts.docker:pf:down: kill $(ps aux | grep docker-pf | grep -v grep | awk '{print $2}') || true
scripts.docker:up:daemon: echo 'Starting services in background.' && npm run docker:up -s -- -d && echo 'Please be patient. Services take several seconds to spin up.'
scripts.docker:down:dump: npm run docker:db:dump -s && npm run docker:down -s
scripts.docker:db:dump: npm run docker:db:dump:schema -s && npm run docker:db:dump:data -s
scripts.docker:db:dump:schema: npm run docker:db:roll:schema -s && echo dumping schema && docker exec -it $(docker ps --format "{{.ID}}" --filter "name=$(basename $(pwd) | sed -e 's/[^a-z0-9]//g')_db_1") mysqldump -uroot -ppass --opt -d -B wordpress > $(pwd)/data/01-schema.sql
scripts.docker:db:dump:data: npm run docker:db:roll:data -s && echo dumping data && docker exec -it $(docker ps --format "{{.ID}}" --filter "name=$(basename $(pwd) | sed -e 's/[^a-z0-9]//g')_db_1") mysqldump -uroot -ppass --quick --single-transaction -t -n -B wordpress > $(pwd)/data/02-data.sql
scripts.docker:db:roll:schema: if [ -f $(pwd)/data/01-schema.sql ]; then echo rolling schema && zip -j $(pwd)/data/01-schema-$(stat -f "%Sm" -t "%Y-%m-%dT%H-%M-%S" $(pwd)/data/01-schema.sql).zip $(pwd)/data/01-schema.sql; fi
scripts.docker:db:roll:data: if [ -f $(pwd)/data/02-data.sql ]; then echo rolling data && zip -j $(pwd)/data/02-data-$(stat -f "%Sm" -t "%Y-%m-%dT%H-%M-%S" $(pwd)/data/02-data.sql).zip $(pwd)/data/02-data.sql; fi
